text:
The Class org.apache.tools.zip.ZipFile cannot handle big ZipFiles >4 GB.
And the problem in that case is, that the method ZipFiles.getEntries()
returns an empty List in that case although there are a lot of entries inside the file.

If you reduce the entries, so that the file is less than 4 GB it works fine.
creator: christoph.kling@de.ibm.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
Christoph, if you are using ant's zip package as a library, I'd recommend
you move to Apache Commons Compress instead, see
http://commons.apache.org/compress/ - this is an improvied version of
Ant's codebase.

Having said that, you'd likely see the same issue there as well.  My guess
is java.io.RandomAccessFile isn't working properly - or just the way
ZipFile expects it to - with files that large.  But at least you have the option
of using ZipArchiveInputstream instead.

Do you get any sort of exception?

Commons Compress is currently on its way of implementing ZIP64 support tracked with https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/COMPRESS-36

Its ZipFile from trunk should support files bigger than 4GB by now.

The changes required over there are hard to sync back since Commons Compress is on its move to Java5 which Ant ist not.  As soon as Commons Compress has been released the Compress Antlib will support big archives transparently.

I don't expect Ant's own ZipFile class to get fixed any time soon.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
bodewig@apache.org
text: Commons Compress 1.3 and the just released Compress Antlib 1.1 now support Zip64 extensions.
